page.title: 14PEACOCK'S HALL FARM
page.content: Peacock's Hall farm is a dairy farm with a large herd of Jersey cattle The farm has an estimated value of half a million pounds,but Mr Clear rents the land for 400 pounds a month. There are 360 animals altogether, these include: 120 Jersey cows;104 cattle;3 bulls;24 chickens (the eggs are eaten by the Clear family);12 peacocks;5 horses;36 pigs;5 cats;and 7dogs.Mr Clear's prize cow is called California, she is 6 years old,and has won lots of competitions.Each year about 170 calves are born (100 male:70 female),and the male ones are sold to be slaughtered after one week.The cows each produce 4000 litres of milk over 10 months of the year.10 cows are milked at a time in a herringbone parlour, which takes 2 hours each time.The cows are fed according to the amount of milk they produce.No crops are grown.
